intro: Praecereus jaenensis, commonly known as the Jaén cactus, is a species of cactus native to southern Spain. It is characterized by its spiny, columnar stems and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
